title: Abuja
summary: Abuja (/əˈbuːdʒə/)[4] is the capital and eighth most populous city of Nigeria. Located in the centre of the country within the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), it is a planned city built in the 1980s based on a master plan by Japanese architect Kenzo Tange.[5] It replaced Lagos, the country's most populous city, as the capital on 12 December 1991.[6]
